page.title: 03Transport
page.content: You are likely to see some interesting vehicles in Lockerley village. The jobs they are doing are:- cranes and excavators working on the pipeline; timber lorries; tractors; combine harvesters and cattle trucks. The pipeline is being constructed from an oil refinery at Fawley to the Midlands. It crosses the B3084 at approx. grid ref 316285 continuing SW to cross the road to East Tytherley at grid ref. 298267, and travels SW across to Critchells Green grid ref. 295261. The timber lorries are travelling through the village to the saw mill at W.Dean. They are carrying softwood from the New Forest, oak from Portsmouth, beech from W.Meon and mahogony from Brazil, W.Africa and Malaysia. Milk is taken to the Salisbury bottling plant by tanker.
